availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas Prather Linthicum (Bardstown, Nelson County, KY, attorney, judge, and politician)

body.p: Bardstown, Nelson County, Kentucky, attorney, judge, and politician. Bardstown native. Attended St. Joseph’s College. Married to Elizabeth Malone Linthicum in Shelby County on November 24, 1830. Father of H. Josephine Linthicum. Student and law partner of Ben Hardin. County prosecutor in Nelson County. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1837. County attorney of Nelson County. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1848 to 1851. Owned eleven enslaved persons in 1850. Nelson County commissioner. Judge of the County Court of Nelson County. President of the Louisville and Bardstown Turnpike Association. Attorney in Nelson County in 1860. Deacon of the Bardstown Baptist Church.
